question: Who of the following players has become the India’s highest capped footballer?
explanation: Sunil Chhetri has become the India’s highest capped footballer by surpassing Bhaichung Bhutia\'s 107 international matches. In his milestone match of the King\'s Cup football tournament in Buriram, Thailand, he scored the lone goal for his side in the 31st minute from a spot kick for his 69th goal. However, his effort did not make any difference as India ranked 101, lost 1-3 to higher ranked Curacao. The 82nd ranked Caribbean island nation has two players associated with English Premier League and some others in European leagues. They scored three goals in the space of 18 minutes through Roly Bonevacia, Elson Hooi and Leandro Bacuna.
